problem_text:
Find all hereditary local formations F of finite groups satisfying the following condition: every finite minimal non-F-group is biprimary. A finite group is said to be biprimary if its order is divisible by precisely two distinct primes.
L. A. Shemetkov
answer: They are found (V. N. Semenchuk, Problems of Algebra: Proc. of the Gomel’ State Univ., no. 1 (15) (1999), 92–102 (Russian)).
